headline: Debate over Dems' counter memo gets heated on 'The Five'

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, it was phenomenal. I was like, "Here we go."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It's hard to imagine. I can't imagine that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. It was so much fun.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You seem like you'd like attention.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And she knows -- did he teach you how to dance?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He's a phenomenal dancer, but so is my mom. But also, then all the teachers were cutting into dance with my dad. It was so bizarre. It was like a weird, like, you know, addition to become the...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Pretty soon we're all just going to have to sit at home and do nothing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't like that.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Cancel everything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't think that, but I do think that they've gone overboard here. I mean, clearly, this is about bonding and affirmation for young women and knowing that Dad cares and Dad is going to go out with you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is not about Stacey's mom, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, right. Thanks for clearing that up.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: But I mean, the thing is, can you have any tradition? Can you at least say, "I remember"? Kimberly had her memory. But the next generation is not going to have those memories.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. You can have the memory. But they just -- they want you to open it up so that, for example, a transgendered child could attend.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: So it doesn't matter, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, but you can make these exceptions.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, they could bring an uncle or a grandfather.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You can make these exceptions.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's what I think. Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, then why don't they do that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think that's what they're going to do.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You can do that, Juan. You've got to make -- you can't be, like, "OK, because one person" -- then whatever. Listen, find a way, make an exception and do it. And it's really important -- and you'll see there are so many studies on this -- that the relationship between daughters and fathers and how important it is for the development, you know, of women for their self- esteem, how they view themselves, their relationships with the opposite sex. So I think we need to leave this one.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I think they're going to -- to your point, they're going to now try to schedule it in such a way that everyone can feel that they are included and it can be for everyone. So I don't have any objection to that, but I don't like the idea that you would cancel it. That to me is beyond the...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I'm going to veto that.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Come on, Staten Island.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: More gender drama ahead. A woman gets a correction on her use of language from the beautiful prime minister of Canada.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Dreamy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dreamy. Wait until you hear what word he took issue with. It's next on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: All right. Last week Canada, which is right near us, made its national anthem gender neutral.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Hardest show on TV.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, whose dad used to run that country, was on a mission to get his fellow countrymen -- I mean country persons on board with the PC lingo. I'm not kidding. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So that's why we came here today to ask you to also look into the policies that religious charitable organizations have in our legislation, so that it can also be changed. Because maternal love is the love that's going to change the future of mankind. So we'd like you to...

utterances.speaker: JUSTIN TRUDEAU, PRIME MINISTER OF CANADA
utterances.sentences: We like to say "peoplekind" not necessarily "mankind." It's more inclusive.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: There we go. Exactly. Yes, thank you.

utterances.speaker: TRUDEAU
utterances.sentences: We can all learn from each other.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think he was joking.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, he's not.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: He's not joking.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He's not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He's not saying it tongue-in-cheek?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: No. But he didn't get elected -- he didn't get elected joking about gender identity. Canada passed Bill C-16. You know what that means?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I do. "C" for Canada.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Which saying gender identity and gender expression into both of the country's human rights code. It's a hate crime to say anything but, I guess, "personkind." Juan, do you buy into this? Are you saying, "He's singing my song"?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Does this go too far even for you, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I don't understand, but I must say, I'm all about, you know, being inclusive. So I like that idea. But I didn't understand this. I've often, like, thought about, like, a word like history. You know, I think...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: His story.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: "... his story."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You're not one of those, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, but I just think...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Never thought of that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I just think it's the way that we, in terms of gender roles and identities, men have dominated. I don't have any -- but I think he's gone a little much.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Gone a little much. I think it's ticking people off.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No. Obviously not. I was going to point out that the audience applauded.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It was a bunch of college students, Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She was there talking about how it needed to go the other way. I think that -- I do think that he was a little bit joking. I don't know. If...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I don't see any account that says he's joking.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Ask Peter. Check your phone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Peter?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You know what? Ask Siri. Siri knows. But Kimberly, this is something. I'm all for being open...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: But I mean, I've had -- I've had somebody I know quite well in a sports class saying, someone put up their hands and said, "Stop saying first baseman. It's first baseperson."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No way.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's where we're going. That's where we're going.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So crazy. I think this is just too much. You know? He's not working for me. I don't -- I'm not feeling it. Are you, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait a minute.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is why we need the wall on the northern border.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I though you thought he was so dreamy and beautiful.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Not to me anymore.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But he's like the kind of guy that pretends to be politically correct just to get girls. Like you know that?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Have you done that, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's, like, kind of like good-looking.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait a minute. Is that what's going on here?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think that might be a little bit.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Are you getting girls with this act?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, but I know guys that play that card to get girls.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's so funny.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They all live in L.A.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Jordan Peterson, who's his -- in his "Bitter Social Enemy" says, the tyrannical bill, which he passed right away, is nothing but social engineering to the nth degree and all in the name of political correctness. I think there's beginning to be blowback in Canada, and I think it's coming here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I love Jordan...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's why the father-daughter dance is banned. It's because of those guys up north.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I love Jordan Peterson. And I think he makes a lot of good points. So maybe Justin Trudeau wasn't joking.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Trust me on this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know, when you're a spokesman, you can be a spokesperson. But a spokesman, it never bothered me to be called a spokesman.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Nobody in the audience even heard of that. No one uses that term.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And they just said, you know, should Neil Armstrong have said "a small step for mankind?" Should he have said "humankind?"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Should he have said "peoplekind"?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know where this comes up? In Congress now, people don't want to be called "chairman." They want to be called the "chairperson" as a woman. And so this comes up all the time. The one that struck me, though, on this issue is that they changed the national anthem in Canada to do away with "patriotic love from thy sons" to all of us, or whatever they changed. But they did away with "sons."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Stick to hockey.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you think at hockey games they're going to be singing "sons"? It will never change.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I've got to tell you this: I have a lengthy tease, so buckle up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing" is next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Time for "One More Thing." Juan, kick it off.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So big space news today with this amazing video. Take a look. Yes. That's the SpaceX Falcon heavy rocket launched earlier today from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. After previous failed attempts, the launch was quite successful. It's a billion-dollar investment in the world's biggest, most powerful rocket. You should also know the rocket is carrying a 250,000 cherry-red Tesla roadster with a dummy pilot dubbed Starman in tribute to the late David Booey.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Bowie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: David Bowie.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Elon Musk, who obviously is paying the bill here, has been putting the car in space for fun and to get the public excited. His goal is to use this rocket so humans can routinely shuttle back and forth between the planets. What, did I say...?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Bowie.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: David Bow-ie. Bowie. Jim Bowie. No, it was Jim Booey.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, Imam, right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was pretty cool to watch today.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It was amazing. I was so glad it worked out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Iman, not Imam. But Iman, yes, the model.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She's the pronunciation guide for the show.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: She knows the supermodels.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You have to be on your toes at all times.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: She knows the supermodels.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know what? You know when you're getting old when this happens. It's a sign of the times. Best Buy declaring that they will no longer sell any CDs. Nothing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's a CD?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And -- I knew you were going to say that. And they're not even going to replace it with anything hard copy.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So I don't know if you guys remember what it was like for you. See, in 1992, CDs took over from tapes. Do you know what tapes are?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Cassette tapes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Did you know what an 8-track tape is?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, I was not around for that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My Dad had one of those adapters. You put it in a big pickup truck.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You can play that. I was trying to think of my first CD. I think my first album was "Thriller" that I got. And then did anyone have "High Voltage"?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I had Abba. I just loved it.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Really? It would later become a play.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I would sit there, at the dining table and listen to the music.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know. So anyway, we're getting a little bit older. No more CDs at Best Buy.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I'm not ready to -- I'm not ready to throw out my VHSs or my CDs or DVDs or Blu-rays yet.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What are your kids going to do? They're going to have to empty out the closets?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. They get to go through my stuff forever.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Stop talking, they said. You.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Wow. They told you to not tell me that. That was a secret. You're not listening.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Megan Albano said you'd got to zip it. OK. So this is a wonderful story. First lady Melania Trump toured the Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center yesterday, and she was briefed by hospital officials about the dramatic rise in opioid-addicted births in this region. And then she got to meet the real stars of the show, the little kiddies. And she shook hands with each child she met and asked them their names and their ages. She's really wonderful with children. She brought White House coloring books, crayons, and Valentines to pass out to the young patients. Do we have a SOT there?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. And she also said, thanking the hospital after the visit, she said, "Children will always be my top priority, and I appreciated the opportunity to visit with the young patients today and witness firsthand their strength and spirit."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'd like to learn more about what they are doing for kids that are born with that addiction. Maybe we'll find out from her. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Me. OK. One of America's greatest presidents would have turned 107 today. Let's take a trip down memory lane. UNIDENTIFIED MALE (singing): Happy birthday to you. Happy birthday, Mr. President. UNIDENTIFIED MALE (singing): Happy birthday to you. Happy birthday, Mr. President. UNIDENTIFIED MALE (singing): Happy birthday to you. Happy birthday, Mr. President.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There he is. Juan's favorite president, as well, too. So we'd all like to wish him a happy birthday to Ronald Reagan here on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: All right. And lastly, it wasn't a good weekend for Mr. Gronkowski. It turns out he lost the Super Bowl. He did not have a great game, especially in the first half, and his house was robbed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Didn't he get two touchdowns?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right. But his house was robbed. They took his guns and his safe. Why? Because his guns were in a safe, and it wasn't nailed down. He had to actually call in and say, "I was robbed." I feel so bad for him. Plus he had a concussion two weeks ago, and he might even retire at the age of 28. Lock your doors. And this is the reason not to be -- this is lucky you're not in the Super Bowl. Because if you're in the Super Bowl, the whole country knows where you are. And so do the bad guys, and they got his stuff.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He just left the door unlocked?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: He might have, possibly, because he's Gronkowski. By the way, if you want to see me on Friday night, you're going to have to go to Barnes & Noble in Ashburn, Virginia, to see "Andrew Jackson: The Miracle of New Orleans." This is the first Barnes & Noble that serves liquor. They're actually selling beers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's how you have to get them to come.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You got it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Washington football...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "Special Report" is up next with Shannon Bream tonight. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
